Blues Harp

My role

  • Concept
  • Design
  • Front-End Development

The Problem

How do make a harmonica more portable?

The Process

Inspired by the Blues bars of london, I had decided to take up the Harmonica. On Christmas morning I unwrapped a beautiful metal instrument, and blew my first note.

Sadly, I quickly realised it was far too cumbersome to carry. My pockets were already full of my phone, wallet and keys. I searched for a more portable solution. The pebble {code} music hack day provided me with the inspiration I needed to create a new musical object I could access anywhere. The digital Blues Harp was born.

In one day, I designed, coded and performed on this new instrument, powered by the Wad.JS library and a dash of JQuery. Amazingly, the performance won me the hack day!

The product

Why bother looking at some images when you can try it out first hand in the browser:

Move your mouse or touch device screen to play.

Play the harp GitHub Repo

ADF Portal

My role

  • Design
  • Front-End Development
  • Project Management
  • User Testing
  • Analytics

The problem

How do you guide teams through a new project management framework?

The Process

As a clients at pebble {code} continued it's Agile transformation, they needed a way engage staff with the various project management frameworks available to them. It was named The Adaptive Delivery Framework (ADF) Portal.

A workshops was arranged with the client to map out the key stages for the Agile, SAFe and Waterfall frameworks. These were mapped to an interactive SVG, through which content could be explored.

The Developers mapped the SVG to unique Urls using Google's Angular JS library. Once this framework was set up, the design could easily be adjusted and the relevant content pages coded. It is browser compatible down to IE9.

The site is tracked using Google Anayltics and receives an average of 2000 hits per month. The next step is to undertake some user testing sessions to add context to this data.

The product

Whisky Map

My role

  • Concept
  • Design
  • Front-End Development

The Problem

How can you tell where your Scottish Whisky comes from?

The Process

As I say sipping the golden spirit in my glass, my mind wandered to the landscapes of Scotland...land of my forefathers.

Unfortunately, I had no clue where this particular drink originated from, so the image in my mind was left incomplete. Nothing but a blurred scene of peaty waters and drizzle.

Lucky for me, the pebble {code} data visualisation hack day encouraged me explore a solution. In 8 hours I gathered a data set of Single Malt flavours, the D3 Javas4cript library and mixed it up with a dash of Leaflet, an open-source mapping library.

The Product

Why not take a look at the results for yourself...

Explore Scotland

Agile Metrics

My role

  • Design Thinking
  • UI Design
  • Front-End Development
  • Project Management

The problem

How do you track Agile adoption levels within a global organisation?

The Process

As a clients at pebble {code} continued it's Agile transformation, its managers wanted a way to track team progress at following the Agile methodology.

First, their current methods were analysed. Teams rated themselves against pre-defined criteria, which was converted in to a spider diagram. Their existing method of representation made it difficult to interpret data effectively.

A workshop with the key stakeholders provided an understand the requirements of this system, from the user's perspective. Three main personas were identified.

  • The Team Member
  • The Agile Coach
  • The Agile Manager

The ideal future scenario was mapped out. Teams would engage in retrospectives with their agile coach, guided by an app. This would allow consistent data to be tracked across all teams, with added contextual information. The app would visualise team progress over the year, while managers would be able to view aggregated reports to see how the company was doing as a whole.

The feature set was honed down to a Minimal Viable Product. Using node & ReactJS, a mobile first, interactive assessment tool was built. Quaterly progress was visualised through D3 charts. An admin section allowed the client to add, edit and remove teams from the system. It is browser compatible down to IE9.

The product

Next steps

The app is being trialled with teams to test its effectiveness. Meanwhile, features to improve the value of the app to managers have been highlighted, and initial designs sketched out, in preparation for the next stage of development.

Sow & Grow

My role

  • Concept
  • Researcg
  • Design
  • Front-End Development
  • Lightning Talk

The Problem

How can I know when to grow and harvest my own vegetables

The Process

In 2015 I had two aims. Firstly, I wanted to improve my JavaScript knowledge. Secondly, I wanted to sample the delights of home grow vegetables in my dinner.

When I found the existing resources on growing vegetables to be lacklustre, I decided to create this app to help fulfil my needs. I gathered data from various resources, and got to work. As the codebase grew larger, so did my crops. You can watch my presentation on the whole experience below.

The Product

Feel free to play with the app, or watch the talk below to hear more about my process.

Trait Mapping

My role

  • Design
  • UX
  • Sass
  • User Research
  • User Testing

The problem

How do you enable staff to track their professional development?

The Process

A new framework for personal development & remuneration was being rolled out at pebble {code}. It mapped ideal traits - Skills, Behaviours & Responsibilities - against which staff could be rated from zero to three.

User research was conducted with those who had been through the initial review process, to understand the areas of friction in the existing process. The main problems highlighted were:

  • Difficulty navigating the spreadsheet of traits.
  • Lack of clarity in the rating system.
  • Difficulty visualsing their current state.

Using these insights, an MVP app was mapped out to address these concerns. A personal desktop app was built using ReactJS. Accounts were managed through Google authentication, enabling users to rate, record and visualise where they are on their career path.

Usabilty testing was performed before the launch, and a more detailed user testing plan was put together for after the review process. The results of this are currently being collected...

The product

Discovering The ADF

My role

  • UX
  • Design
  • Front-End Development
  • Animation
  • Project Management

The problem

How can you educated busy staff?

The Process

A workshop was run by pebble {code}, to understand the training requirements of the client's employees. The main aim of this training course being to promote the benefits of the new Adaptive Delivery Framework.

An empathy mapping exercise around staff personas identified the users' key attributes and expectations.

From this analysis the following criteria were constructed:

  • Modular
  • Adaptable
  • Concise
  • Mobile
  • Mixed Media
  • Personal

A four-week build schedule was proposed.Wireframes for a set of training module were produced. Each module would consist of a three-minute animation, some reading and a short quiz. Users could choose to learn through video or text, but had to finish at least one before attempting to pass the quiz.

It was built as a static site, before being into the client's SCORM system. It is browser compatible down to IE9.

The product

Emoti

My Role

  • Concept
  • Web Design
  • 3D Design
  • Front-End Development

The Problem

How would you visualise the Emotional state of the world?

The Process

At #ArtHackathon2015, our team of artists and designers created a possible solution, in the form of a light and sound installation, powered by tweets.

Using the Twitter post fetcher, I altered the colours and music of a webpage according to each emotional response of tweets, in real time. This was then visualised on the browser of a Raspberry Pi. Using lazer-cut acryclic mounted on to an LED screen, a glowing, morphing sculpture was created.

The Product

The 3D version has been dismantled (for now), but feel free to check out the code behind it.

GitHub Repo

Guess Hex

My role

  • Concept
  • Design
  • Front-End Development

The Problem

How do you make an incredibly hard game about hex colours?

The Process

Another day, another pebble {code} hack day. This time, the theme was gaming. I chose to build a mobile friendly colour matching game, using JQuery Mobile.

The Product

To win, you have to try and convert Hex to HSL in your head, and move the sliders to the right combination. The closer the match, the higher the score.

Test my hex skills GitHub Repo

Attain

My role

  • Concept
  • Design
  • Sloppy Front-End Development
  • Sound recording

The Problem

How do you rapidly prototype a science-fiction brand for filming?

The Process

It was the weekend of the Sci Fi London 2015 24h film competition. We had the beginnings of a story of a dystopian existence in which companies could access the minds of willing people. The company - Attain - needed a brand and an interface for it's users.

While the team finalised the scripts I fleshed out a design for the Attain UI that could be used captured on camera that same afternoon.

The Product

The application was only built for a specific screen size, and many elements were dropped in as SVG's straight out of the comps, but feel free to take a look. The film was never finalized, but you can enjoy a rough cut below.

(Any username or password will suffice)
